title: Direct Cholinomimetics
author: ayobami
description: the start of a two-part series examinining direct-cholinomimetics

questions.question: cholinomimetics are drugs that mimic the action of acetylcholine in the body
direct cholinomimetics directly bind to ACh(acetylcholine) receptors to mediate their effects
bethanechol is a drug that has an effect on both muscarinic and nicotinic receptors
the following drugs are all direct cholinomimetic esters: carbachol, bethanechol, muscarine, methacholine
the following drugs are all direct cholinomimetic alkaloids: pilocarpine, cevimeline, nicotine, muscarine
bethanechol is indicated mainly for asthma diagnosis
pilocarpine is typically taken into the body orally
